page.title: 06SCHOOLS IN GENERAL
page.content: There are few schools in this rural area, usually they have a low number of pupils, like in Peterchurch Primary School there are 100 pupils and in Fairfield High School there are 200 pupils. In winter there is usually a low attendence in schools because of the weather. Snow and ice is a big problem which can cause some people to be cut off for a couple of days, but coaches have to be used to take children to school. And so the roads have to be totally clear of snow before they can run. Also the buses sometimes break down because of the cold which can be severe. Now in the local area there are no school dinners. with children either going home for dinner, eating sandwichs or going to the chip van.
